learning.title: Test Cheating Anti-patterns: ABOMINATION

problem.description:
E2E tests were found to be "cheating" by not properly failing on HTTP error codes. Per CLAUDE.md: "CHEATING ON TESTS = ABOMINATION"
Tests were silently handling error status codes by printing them instead of failing with assertions. This violates the fundamental principle that tests must fail hard on unexpected conditions.
problem.impact: - Tests appear to pass when services are actually failing - Silent failures mask real production issues - False confidence in system stability - Regression issues go undetected - Violates core testing principles

pattern.name: Silent Status Code Handling
Catch-All Exception Handling
Boolean Return Instead of Assertion
pattern.correct_approach: # CORRECT: Use assertions that fail the test try: await self.auth_tester.api_client.call_api(method, endpoint, None, headers) raise AssertionError(f"Security failure: {endpoint} should have been blocked but wasn't") except UnauthorizedException: # This is expected - test passes pass

principles.principle: Tests MUST fail hard on unexpected conditions
Never silently handle errors in tests
HTTP error codes (404, 500, etc.) should cause test failures
Connection errors should cause test failures
Use explicit assertions instead of boolean returns
Only catch specific exceptions you expect
Re-raise assertion errors to preserve test failure chain

solution.implementation_guide: 1. Replace all print statements for error codes with assertions 2. Convert boolean returns to explicit assertions 3. Add specific exception handling for expected errors 4. Re-raise all unexpected exceptions as AssertionErrors 5. Add clear error messages explaining why the test failed 6. Never use bare except clauses in tests 7. Never use try/except with pass in tests

verification_steps.step: Search for anti-patterns: grep for "status_code.*print" in tests
Search for catch-all exceptions: grep for "except.*pass" in tests
Search for boolean returns: grep for "return False.*Should" in tests
Run tests with --fail-fast to ensure they fail immediately on errors
Verify no silent failures by checking test output for error prints

prevention.recommendation: Add linting rules to detect test cheating patterns
Code review checklist must include test failure verification
Run tests with verbose output to catch silent failures
Use pytest-strict mode to enforce proper test behavior
Document test writing standards in TEST_CREATION_GUIDE.md

learning.claude_md_reference: CLAUDE.md states unequivocally: "CHEATING ON TESTS = ABOMINATION" "ALL TESTS MUST BE DESIGNED TO FAIL HARD IN EVERY WAY" "ALL ATTEMPTS TO BYPASS THIS WITHIN THE TEST ITSELF ARE BAD" "TESTS MUST RAISE ERRORS. DO NOT USE try accept blocks in tests."
